module.name: LazLinkedList
module.short: Defines a simple doubly linked list

element.name: TLinkListItem
element.short: Implements an item in a doubly linked list

descr.p: TLinkListItem is a class which implements an item in a doubly linked list. It represents the traversal nodes used in TLinkList, including the terminal (or sentinel) node. Properties are provided to access and maintain the Prior and Next items in the node traversal order.

element.name: TLinkListItem.Next
element.short: Contains a reference to the next item in the doubly linked list

element.name: TLinkListItem.Prior
element.short: Contains a reference to the previous item in the doubly linked list

element.name: TLinkListItem.ResetItem
element.short: Removes the references to the previous and next items for the list item

descr.p: ResetItem sets the values in the Prior and Next properties to Nil.

element.name: TLinkList
element.short: Defines a simple doubly linked list class

descr.p: TLinkList is a class which defines a navigational interface for a simple doubly linked list.

TLinkList provides properties used to access the First and Last items in the linked list, the number of list items in Count, and the first free item in the linked list. Items in the linked list are represented using the TLinkListItem class, which provides Prior and Next properties for navigation of items in the list.

TLinkList contains an abstract virtual CreateItem method that is used to create new items for the linked list. The method must be implemented in a descendent class to provided implementation details that address storage and ownership of the linked list items. See TGtkMessageQueue for an example of a concrete implementation of the TLinkList class.

element.name: TLinkList.FFirstFree
element.short: First free item in the linked list

element.name: TLinkList.FFreeCount
element.short: Number of free items in the linked list

element.name: TLinkList.FFirst
element.short: First list item in the linked list

element.name: TLinkList.FLast
element.short: Last list item in the linked list

element.name: TLinkList.FCount
element.short: Number of items in the linked list

element.name: TLinkList.DisposeItem
element.short: Removes the specified item from the linked list, and optionally frees the item instance

element.name: TLinkList.DisposeItem.AnItem
element.short: List item updated in the method

element.name: TLinkList.Unbind
element.short: Removes the traversal nodes for the specified linked list item

element.name: TLinkList.Unbind.AnItem
element.short: Linked list item updated in the method

element.name: TLinkList.CreateItem
element.short: Specifies the interface used to create a new linked list item for the class

descr.p: CreateItem is an abstract virtual method which specifies the interface used to create a new linked list item for the class. The return value is the TLinkListItem class instance allocated in the method. CreateItem must be be implemented in a descendent class to handle storage and ownership for the items created in the linked list.
CreateItem is used in the implementation of the GetNewItem method.

element.name: TLinkList.CreateItem.Result
element.short: New link list item allocated in the method

element.name: TLinkList.GetNewItem
element.short: Gets a new linked list item by reusing a free item or creating a new one

descr.p: GetNewItem is a TLinkListItem function used to get a new item for the doubly linked list. GetNewItem checks for an unused item in the linked list, and creates a new TLinkListItem instance when a free item is not found. A reused item is updated to remove the Prior and Next traversal nodes in the linked list item. A new item is retrieved by calling the CreateItem method.

element.name: TLinkList.GetNewItem.Result
element.short: Linked list item reused or created in the method

element.name: TLinkList.AddAsLast
element.short: Configures and adds the specified item as the terminal node for the doubly linked list

descr.p: AddAsLast is a procedure used to make the specified list item the terminal node in the doubly linked list. AddAsLast updates the list item in AnItem by setting its Prior property to the node in Last. The value in its Next property is set to Nil. The updated list item is then assigned as the new value for the Last property. The value in First may be set to the value in AnItem when a prior node in the traversal order is not available.
AddAdLast increments the value in the Count property.

element.name: TLinkList.AddAsLast.AnItem
element.short: Item saved as the last item in the linked list

element.name: TLinkList.First
element.short: First item in the doubly linked list

descr.p: First is a read-only TLinkListItem property which represents the first traversal node in the doubly linked list. The value in First is updated in methods like Unbind and AddAsLast.

element.name: TLinkList.Last
element.short: Last item in the doubly linked list

descr.p: Last is a read-only TLinkListItem property which represents the last (or terminal) traversal node in the doubly linked list. The value in Last is updated in methods like Unbind anf AddAsLast.

element.name: TLinkList.Count
element.short: Total number of items used in the doubly linked list

descr.p: Count is a read-only Integer property which contains the number of traversal nodes in the doubly linked list. The value in Count is updated in method like Unbind and AddAsLast.

element.name: TLinkList.Delete
element.short: Removes the specified list item from the doubly linked list

descr.p: Delete is a procedure used to remove the specified list item from the traversal nodes in the doubly linked list. No actions are performed in the method when AnItem is unassigned (contains Nil).

Delete calls Unbind to update the traversal node for the affected list items. The Prior and Next nodes in AnItem are set to Nil to remove the item from the node order. Delete decrements the value in the Count property.

element.name: TLinkList.Delete.AnItem
element.short: Item removed from the traversal nodes in the list

element.name: TLinkList.MoveToLast
element.short: Relocates the specified list item to the last (or terminal) node for the linked list

descr.p: MoveToLast is a procedure used to move the specified list item to the last (or terminal) node in the doubly linked list. No actions are performed in the method when AnItem is unassigned (contains Nil).

MoveToLast calls Unbind to ensure that AnItem is removed from the node traversal order in the linked list. MoveToLast calls AddAsLast to update the values in the Prior and Next properties in AnItem making it the terminal node in the traversal order.

element.name: TLinkList.MoveToLast.AnItem
element.short: Item moved to the last node in the linked list

element.name: TLinkList.Clear
element.short: Removes all items in the doubly linked list

descr.p: Clear is a procedure used to remove all items in the doubly linked list. Clear uses the class instance in First as the initial TLinkListItem in the node traversal order. While the node is assigned, it calls the Delete method for each of the TLinkListItem instances.

element.name: TLinkList.ConsistencyCheck
element.short: Checks the validity of traversal nodes and node counts in the doubly linked list

element.name: TLinkList.ConsistencyCheck.Result
element.short: Returns 0 when the traversal nodes and counts are valid, or a negative value an inconsistency is found

element.name: TLinkList.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance

element.name: TLinkList.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance

descr.p: Destroy calls Clear, and frees the unused items in the linked list. Destroy calls the inherited destructor prior to exiting from the method.
